column2: @b0nzi_ @nftworldsNFT I previously DMed you about buying back one of the frozen Worlds that was stolen from me. It might be in Message Requests.

@TheDinoSociety The biggest difference is greed. The 2-3 ETH on some anon project are often looking for 10x quick returns. For many it has nothing to do with the art, team, or long-term fundamentals. It‚Äôs a fallacy though, way more success is found investing in real creators.

DYOR. For me the fundamentals of NFTW are a bullish intersection between Minecraft, Metaverse, NFTs, and crypto economics. It‚Äôs a platform that dozens of projects are already building on. I own 5 worlds and will be staking them all long-term.

Who has been with me holding @nftworldsNFT since the free mint?

What @Temptranquil & @iamarkdev have accomplished in the past 6 months is legendary.

I still think the platform is just getting started üåé ‚ù§Ô∏è
To add I will always try to make my position (holding) and any relationship transparent. If I don‚Äôt I hope people call me out!

I crossed 10k followers ü§Ø already get DMs about doing paid shills. Has opened my eyes to how marketing through some influencers works in this space.

Making a commitment now, I will never take any form of compensation for promo. I will only invest and share things I believe in.

Question: You buy a very rare NFT for a too good to be true price (below floor). A few hours later you discover it was part of a hack and stolen. It has been blacklisted on a major exchange. The victim reaches out and offers *more* than you paid. What do you do?

During the OS Signature Attack dozens of Vizzies jumped into voice chat. Some even offered to fly and come chill with me. This support continues and made a huge difference. Love them all ‚ù§Ô∏èüôèü§ó https://t.co/T4UohW8IHI
@Namstaaah @nftworldsNFT No real update. Investigations ongoing.
Great thread on some technical details for the OpenSea Signature Attack. https://t.co/UayH23KOg7
@jpablosanchez @gigabit_eth @punk9059 You must be fun at parties.

@punk9059 @davidbankless @runner_data We only know one thing for certain, because the blockchain doesn't lie. The transfers happened through OS contract, using a valid wyvern order signature, and that the order was crafted in a clever (exploitive) way.

Everything else is speculation and being investigated.

@punk9059 @davidbankless @runner_data I also went through 35 days of browser history page by page, with one of my devs for a second pair of eyes. Nothing jumped out as the regular vector of a fake site. Went through every MM connected site, same thing, nothing crazy.

@punk9059 @davidbankless @runner_data Correct, we do not know how or where it was served. What we do know is it wasn't an email, and wasn't an obvious phishing site. I have been through MM connected sites with 4 other victims. Our overlap is very small (less than 12) - and all trusted well known platforms/projects.
@1202reklaW @punk9059 @hofman_eth It‚Äôs been a crazy (and stressful ride). I think most of crypto Twitter just ran with ‚ÄúEmail phish, people connected and signed something dumb‚Äù and moved on.
@1202reklaW @punk9059 @hofman_eth It‚Äôs true we still don‚Äôt know, we haven‚Äôt heard anything because we still don‚Äôt know.

@punk9059 I am one of the victims (lost seven figures worth of NFT Worlds). It wasn‚Äôt email phishing, it wasn‚Äôt some fake phishing site. Investigations are ongoing, but I think the results are going to shock.
@Leader DMed, also it wasn‚Äôt an email, OS has confirmed this publicly.
@nifty_1337 @nftworldsNFT @iamarkdev @Temptranquil Would be amazing. They are blocked for trading on OS.
@3PiedPiper @nftworldsNFT I haven‚Äôt received anything. I think it‚Äôs still early - smoke hasn‚Äôt cleared yet.
@andypoondesign @nftworldsNFT Thanks sir, I appreciate it üôè
@sammy_ruler @nftworldsNFT @belikewater893 Mel is awesome, just DMed! I am a large RR holder.

Where the exploit side comes in is that with this one malicious signed wyvern order it appears the attacker was able to craft any order. Effectively giving full access to any contract approved for the OS proxy (when you "Approve All" to list items on OS).

(Origin in the MM dialog doesn't matter.)

What is believed about this attack is that they crafted a malicious Wyvern order and got victims to sign it somewhere (phished).

https://t.co/BOTvU2REHb

I am not an expert, this is my understand from what experts have told me.

OpenSea uses Wyvern Protocol (the new and old contract). On older Wyvern signatures looked like the screenshot above. What you are signing is an order to be submitted to the exchange contract.

Ever sign one of these?

This is the reason I call the OpenSea signature attack part phish and part exploit.

üßµ https://t.co/P8unPOamSj

A few things about the OpenSea signature attack I see media still getting wrong:

- It wasn't from email, they still haven't found the source but I think it is going to surprise people.
- I alone lost over $2MM (all in @nftworldsNFT)
- It appears to be a mixed phish and exploit.
@Freecard_NFT @theYounGGod18 Please check DM message requests.

@jeuaneth @opensea @LooksRareNFT @DAO_JOKER @thekinggully I believe they are all locked on OS now. Doesn't prevent attacker from using another marketplace, and many of them have already changed hands more than once.
@kgirl_nfty Thank you for the support. I always knew what great people are in this space, although I am crushed I am reminded of all the beautiful people that want to help üôè

@NFTYOUIO @AJFromDiscord @ZeeroII @Layer2Trust @fokner65 @_mpoxoqm @mrcse13 @Freecard_NFT @DAO_JOKER @thekinggully @_cynmedia @Nate_Rivers @janclarin @aldrinaldana @ManuSpotstone @0xQuit I did use x2y2 (very carefully) but comparing notes with other victims some didn't use it at all.

I am hunting through everything. From my understand it would have been one single signature that looked like this, and that gave them access to anything you had proxy approved (approve all) on OS. And the origin could have been anything. https://t.co/HPtaUJSmkz

@DAO_JOKER @NFTYOUIO @Layer2Trust @fokner65 @_mpoxoqm @mrcse13 @Freecard_NFT @thekinggully @AJFromDiscord @_cynmedia @Nate_Rivers @ZeeroII @janclarin @aldrinaldana @ManuSpotstone Hey fellow victim, DM me please.
@cyborg_eth Thanks üôè

Lots of bad information floating around. Wait for facts, OS is doing a good job sifting through.

As a victim I have felt well taken care of, multiple people at OS have reached out to check in and try to help ‚ù§Ô∏è https://t.co/uP7T6ariqW
@iamashchild I didn‚Äôt, the only approval was OS. The attack seems to allow the attacker to transfer any OS approved collection (from one signature).
@L0rdHighFix3r @iamarkdev @Portal_____ I lost 20‚Ä¶. (Attacker took all 25 then returned 5) üò¢
@L0rdHighFix3r @iamarkdev @Portal_____ Yup good policy. Never click email links. I am the same, if I see something I go straight to the site.

@L0rdHighFix3r @iamarkdev @Portal_____ It was likely phished by signing a wyvern transaction somewhere else that took advantage of the way OS validates matches. It wasn‚Äôt a simple phishing email with approve all attack vector. https://t.co/yg3J1MiT2t

@iamarkdev @L0rdHighFix3r @Portal_____ I am not a contract dev but the way I understand it I could have signed a wyvern transaction somewhere that seemingly had nothing to do with OS but basically granted full access to any of my OS proxy approvals.
@iamarkdev @L0rdHighFix3r @Portal_____ It was confirmed by OS to not be. It was more sophisticated than a simple phish (I never even click email links). https://t.co/Aycla5xS4I
@iamarkdev üò¢ üåé
@L0rdHighFix3r @Portal_____ @iamarkdev It wasn‚Äôt a phishing attack to migrate.
@kgirl_nfty @Helloimmorgan Thanks for the invite üôè - I am in a rough place and don't have the energy for a public space. Spending time with friends :)
@kgirl_nfty @IndexOfSus Thanks, I am pretty beat up, I can't face a public chat right now.
Thanks for the support everyone ‚ù§Ô∏èüôè, @OpenSea has reached out and I had a call with them. They are investigating and on top of it, I am impressed, helping however I can.

I would really appreciate the help of an expert that is respected in the space. This is devastating to me and I need to decide how to move forward. Without knowing what went wrong I don't know what to do to mitigate future losses.

I honestly don't know what happened. I am a dev, long time crypto user, hardware wallet. I did have NFT Worlds approved on OpenSea. I didn't migrate or use the new contract yet.
Everyone - it appears I was compromised. This is a sick huge loss. I don't know what happened. I am going to have to figure it out. 25 NFT Worlds stolen, attacker returned 5 for some reason.

@TalmadgeOrion @nftworldsNFT When I was personally doing DD I looked at Decentraland/Sandbox market, Minecraft data (especially MAUs), the non-crypto Minecraft economy (service providers, large communities, building, etc), and gaming NFT trends. @memphis_mantis @the_x2y2 No problem, always DYOR üòâ. In the end I think we will have dozens of popular marketplaces. Part of the beauty of web3 is you own the content, account, everything, so it doesn't matter what site you transact on. They will all target different niches.
@Gabadadi Also the team had so much conviction they minted the project for free. Never did paid or hype marketing. Just built and delivered. The opposite of a house of cards or amateur.

@Gabadadi I disagree. Non crypto Minecraft is a multi billion dollar economy, and I am not talking about MC itself (the platform) but the businesses/people building on it. As a platform MC continues to lead the Metaverse. Gaming is the next big crypto adopter. It is the perfect storm. https://t.co/MX2b6cQR4t
@Matt_i_e @timepieces I guess I could always keep them all and just buy the artist pieces I like üòÜ, win/win

@memphis_mantis @the_x2y2 It ran smooth and fast, UX was easy to follow. The bulk tool was literally perfect (marketplaces need more tools like this). You could feel that the product team is professional and experienced. With 20 years building dev & product teams you just pick up a sense for it.
